fullProgramDescription: The Bioengineering program at UC San Diego is an interdisciplinary major that combines engineering principles with biological sciences to develop innovative solutions for health and medicine. The program provides a foundation in engineering, mathematics, and physical sciences, as well as a deep understanding of biological systems. Students learn to apply engineering principles to medical and biological problems, preparing them for careers in industry, research, or graduate study.
shortProgramDescription: The Bioengineering B.S. program at UC San Diego integrates engineering and biological sciences to prepare students for careers in health and medicine.
classHighlights: Mathematics and Physics: Students complete a series of mathematics and physics courses, including Calculus (MATH 20A-B-C-D), Physics (PHYS 2A-B-C), and Differential Equations (MATH 20D or MATH 31).

Engineering Foundations: The program includes foundational engineering courses such as Introduction to Bioengineering (BE 1 or BE 100), Biomechanics (BE 120 or BE 220), and Biomaterials (BE 130 or BE 230).

Biological Sciences: Students take a range of biological sciences courses, including Introduction to Biology (BILD 1 or BILD 3), Biochemistry (BICD 100 or CHEM 114A-B), and Molecular Biology (BICD 110 or BICD 120).
Bioengineering Core: The major includes core bioengineering courses such as Biomechanics (BE 120 or BE 220), Biomaterials (BE 130 or BE 230), and Systems Physiology (BE 140 or BE 240).
Technical Electives: Students choose from a range of technical electives, including courses in bioinformatics, biomedical devices, and tissue engineering.
learningOutcomes: Apply engineering principles to biological systems
Design and develop biomedical devices and systems
Understand the biological and physical principles underlying human physiology
Analyze and interpret data from biological systems
Communicate complex ideas and results effectively
Work effectively in teams to solve complex problems
additionalInformation: Students must complete a set of required courses, including mathematics, physics, and biology. The major also includes a set of core bioengineering courses and technical electives. Students are encouraged to participate in research and internship opportunities.
